title: How to Make a Banana and Oatmeal Milkshake

steps.headline: Slice a banana into pieces about 1/8" thick.
Add the slices to the blender with a few ice cubes.
Pour a package of the oatmeal of your choosing.
Pour in milk, to moisten the oatmeal.
steps.description: The milk helps with mixing the banana and oatmeal together.

steps.headline: Blend to whatever consistency you enjoy drinking.
steps.description: It is recommended that you use the liquefy setting for something thinner, and the blend or puree setting for something a little bit thicker.

steps.headline: Pour the drink into a glass.
Serve.
steps.description: If using a straw, use a wide one. It also helps to have a teaspoon to pick up any thick sludge at the end of the milkshake.

steps.headline: Slice the bananas into 1/8" thick slices.
steps.description: Add the slices to a bowl. Then mash the bananas with either a fork, or a potato masher.

steps.headline: Mix in the package of oatmeal.
steps.description: Stir to make gloppy oatmeal banana mash.

steps.headline: Pour the mash into a cocktail shaker.
Pour the milkshake into a glass.
Serve.
steps.description: If using a straw, use a wide one. It also helps to have a teaspoon to pick up any thick sludge at the end of the milkshake.

steps.headline: Place all of the ingredients in the blender.
Pour into a glass.
steps.description: Garnish, if wished, with a little extra cinnamon or nutmeg.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: If using a straw, use a wide one. It also helps to have a teaspoon to pick up any thick sludge at the end of the milkshake; that wheatgerm is good for you!

text: Basic Banana Oatmeal Milkshake Slice a banana into pieces about 1/8" thick.  Add the slices to the blender with a few ice cubes.  Pour a package of the oatmeal of your choosing.  Pour in milk, to moisten the oatmeal. The milk helps with mixing the banana and oatmeal together. Blend to whatever consistency you enjoy drinking. It is recommended that you use the liquefy setting for something thinner, and the blend or puree setting for something a little bit thicker. Pour the drink into a glass.  Serve. If using a straw, use a wide one. It also helps to have a teaspoon to pick up any thick sludge at the end of the milkshake. Using a Masher or Fork Slice the bananas into 1/8" thick slices. Add the slices to a bowl. Then mash the bananas with either a fork, or a potato masher. Mix in the package of oatmeal. Stir to make gloppy oatmeal banana mash. Pour the mash into a cocktail shaker. Add milk. Add the lid. Shake thoroughly to combine. Pour the milkshake into a glass.  Serve. If using a straw, use a wide one. It also helps to have a teaspoon to pick up any thick sludge at the end of the milkshake. Honey Oatmeal Banana Milkshake Slice the bananas.  Place all of the ingredients in the blender.  Blend for 45 seconds.  Pour into a glass. Garnish, if wished, with a little extra cinnamon or nutmeg. Serve. If using a straw, use a wide one. It also helps to have a teaspoon to pick up any thick sludge at the end of the milkshake; that wheatgerm is good for you!
